title: typefaces with high x-height
content:
Hi everybody,  
i’m looking for san-serif typefaces with a high x-height.

Vectora is good.  
are there more?

thanks heaps.

 [‹ \*\*Please can you help?\*\*](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829233608/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16421 "Go to previous forum topic") [Werkplaats Typografie??? [...continued] ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829233608/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16419 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kib820

comments.content: [Futura Maxi](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829233608/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&displayfontid=C.106298.0.0) is about as high as it gets without going unicase
What will you use it for?
Almost anything ITC (Herb Lubalin’s days) and Forever from Treacyfaces.
Also look at Vista from Emigre

While I don’t have it, so don’t know how it sets up, I love the looks of LTTRRR’s “New Critter”:  
 [http://letterror.com/catalog/critter/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829233608/http:/letterror.com/catalog/critter/index.html "http://letterror.com/catalog/critter/index.html")

It’s just so happy.

Antique Olive.  
Extension or Lesmore (by Usherwood, from Red Rooster)  
Maybe try some agate faces?

Yeah, what David asked.

But just to throw out my fav: [FF Quadraat Headliner](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829233608/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11187.0.0).  
Looking at that you get a pretty good grasp of what  
so many non-Latin adaptations actually feel like... :-/

hhp
